moves.6. c4 g6 7. d4 exd4 8. Nxd4 Bd7 9. Nxc6: With both players castled, the opening is finished and the interesting part of the game begins.
moves.12. Nc3 Qe7 13. cxd6: An interesting choice, undoubling the Black QB Pawns.
moves.20. Bxd7 Nxd7: Uncovering his fianchettoed B, which now commands the long diagonal.
moves.21. Ba3 Rac8: Intending to push the Q-side Pawns.
moves.22. Rc1 Bf8: Defending the QBP, which supports the valuable passed QP.
moves.27. Bxf8 c3: Now he has 2 connected passed Pawns.
moves.29... Rxd5 30. exd5 Qxd5 31. Red1: Both players are locked in on Cohn's passed Pawns.
moves.31... Ne6 32. Qxa6: Now Duras has 2 connected passed Pawns of his own.
moves.32... Ra8 33. Qe2 d3: Sacrificing the Pawns in order to get his Rook on the 7th rank.
moves.34. Rxd3 Qg5 35. Qe3 Rxa2+: The game hangs in the balance. Cohn plays for a mating attack.
moves.39. Rc3c8+: Duras has to make forcing moves of his own.
moves.39... Kg7: Trying to find refuge from the checks so he has time for ... Q-N7 mate.
moves.40... f6: Defending with tempo: an attack on the Queen.
moves.42... g5 43. hxg5+: The critical juncture. 43... PxP! draws the game.
moves.43... Nxg5: The losing move. Duras now unleashes an incredible winning combination.
moves.44. Rxh7+: With the Knight pinned, Cohn has no choice.
moves.44... Kxh7: Foced if he wants to preserve his Queen.
moves.45. Qe7+: With Cohn still having a mate in 1 if Duras lets up for a moment, Duras presses the attack.
moves.45... Kg6: One again, the only move to avoid losing the Q.
moves.46. Rg8+: Relentlessly forcing the King into the danger zone.
moves.46... Kf5: Now the White Pawns further restrict the K.
moves.47. Rxg5+: This brilliant sacrifice caps Duras' remarkable winning sequence. If Cohn tries 47... PxR, 48 Q-Q7 ch wins the Q and the game. So...
moves.48. Qg7+: Cohn resigns. If his King moves to the KR file, 49 Q-R8 ch wins the Q. If he plays 48... K-B4, 49 Q-Q7 ch wins the Q. An incredible attacking sequence by Duras to conclude a remarkable game by both men.

opening: Ruy Lopez (C77), Morphy defence, Duras variation
